content:
Posted: June 25, 2014
												Ok, so I just recently got this game on steam, but I've been playing it for over two years now.This game has some very addicting combat mechanics, which are very fast paced later on in the game. There are many character types to choose from, each offering a different playstyle. Along with great gameplay, this game also offers good graphics, and a somewhat destructable environment which u can take to your advantage during some enemy encounters. With that said however this game does have its drawbacks. The majority of the player base is focused towards the later part of the game, which would be fine, but this leaves those at earlier stages left to fend forthemselves, making progrssion lonely, and boring at times. Once you do get to the later parts of the game you soon realise that attaining certain armor and weapons almost impposible as extremely poor drop rates, and insanely high prices means only a lucky few will aquire said items. But don't be discouraged, because even with deacent gear, and sharpened skills you can still play and enjoy every aspect of this game.To conclude, this game certainly isnt perfect, however, if you find a good guild and make some new friends, you will have a great time slashing and bashing monesters and look good doing it. The gameplay will keep you coming back, and there will always be more improvements to make to the characters you play.If your at least curious about this game I highly recomend you try it, you might be pleasantly surprised. I'll see you in there. :)

This was way before Vindictus went on steam :3.I loved this game...when it first came out. It was absolutley amazing. And the community was awesome. Everyone worked as a team. The grinding was was not tedious.THE COMBAT WAS SO AMAZING! Every move was precise and the physics were just out standing.  .And I say this because every battle was different. The crafting was also worth the time. All and all back then...I would have giving it a 9/10.Fast Forward today.No, I can not reccomend this game. I decided to get back into it and see whats changed. And to be honest...it sucks.I got spammed with bots and people weren't very nice anymore. NO one worked as a team in my experience. This game had a lot of potential. And I feel like some of it..isnt there anymore. Combat is still decent. But what annoys me is the damage indicators... That really annoys me. Because before. You hit an enemy and it's like.. Damn, I must've hit him hard. And made you wanna hit this enemy more. Now with damage indicators its like... 20 damage... Well damn. I dont feel that immersed anymore. And the list goes on and on.MY verdict...You can play this game. But...In my opinion, its not really worth the time and effort

content:
Posted: July 6, 2014
												I reached a point where I find myself looking to the free-to-play mmo's for a source of entertainment. This is how I came across Vindictus.It's looks like it should be a fine, top of the line mmo; but with one flaw that breaks the game before the player actually starts. It was made by Nexon.Yes, the same Nexon that made the buggy as hell, hacker-infested Combat Arms.I decided to move past this, thinking Nexon got their act together, and decided to try the game for myself. I installed the game, and was met by not one, but seven launcher crashes in a row. On attempt number eight., I was faced with a long♥♥♥♥♥background instalation that made me think the game crashed again. Attempt number nine actually got me into the game, but as I tried to connect to the server, the game crashed entirely. Three more attempts just to get into the game resulted in the same crash. Hell, even a personal friend with a recently updated PC even crashed as much as I did trying to get in.Take my word for it, the game is not worth the amount of time it will take just to start the bloody launcher.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 3, 2013
												This game really caught my eye for one reason.  It was actually Free to Play, unlike every other MMO known to mankind.  The only things you actually have to pay for aren't necessary for completion of the game.  I haven't actually paid for anything yet in the game.  There's also offers to earn NX, the ingame currency.  So, if you want, you could complete the entire game without touching your wallet.  The gameplay is simple, yet addictive.  While some runs may need to be repeated to reach the next level(and unlock the next quest), the boss battles can be challenging, and good fun.  Along with these are "Oaths of Honor", which are small challenges to make the run more difficult(Example, complete the quest under a set time, or use no potions).  You can jump into battle with one of the six characters in the game.  Do you want to charge in swords-a-blazing?  Snipe your foes with a longbow?  Crush everyone with a Cestus?  The choice is yours.Anyway, I hope this review has helped you decide on this game(And hopefully, I got it accurate xD).

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 28, 2012
												Wow, I remember this one from years ago.  It has one of the most fully-developed physics engines of any MMO I've ever seen.  The four characters (I remember when it was only three, and it may be five soon) all played very differently and honestly, the only one I couldn't really get into playing was Lann (the dual swordsman).  Lastly, a very good story for an MMO.I feel that its only major flaw is that it's of the hub-and-mission style of MMOs - probably done so they can ensure the physics engine is handled correctly.  However, that flaw is tremendous in a scenario where the 'hub' is an actual area where the players gather, because the lag gets horrendous.Unfortunately this is one of those games that's marred by the company that holds it - Nexon.  Nexon has NO idea how to deal with any kind of customer support and is notorious for pay-to-win problems.  The latter doesn't actually rear its head NEARLY as much as it did in DFO, but there are still shades of it.Overall, my bad experiences with Nexon are the main thing preventing me from recommending this.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 1, 2014
												Beautiful game. Amazing storyline. Creative monsters. Prelude to my second favorite game made by Nexon.This game has the most beautiful artwork and concepts of armor I have ever seen. Each character is crafted as their own. While the facial features might be the same for all characters, it really doesn't matter when you can personalize any way you want from skin tone to make-up to even under armor. The characters move so in tune with their weapons nothing seems unnatural.The storyline is fantastic, especially because this is all a prelude to Nexon's Mabinogi. This game is much more serious than Mabinogi and it certainly gives you a break from the care-free enviroment of it, which is sometimes nice. The storyline I can keep track of pretty well with easy to remember names and (regretably) a very small map with 2 towns, one you are in 90% of the time. The monsters are your usual monsters, but with a little twist and have such amazing graphics and design to them. Gnolls are transformed and given clever names, ranks, titles and even abilities and stray from your usual dog-man creature. Nexon really nailed it on this one when it comes to 3D monster art.As I said before, this game leads up to Nexon's Mabinogi (which is another great game by them). This clears up some of the plot to Mabinogi and this is all around a good plot on it's own.This game is absolutely perfect for a gamer who loves running dungeons with an amazing looking character. If you aren't downloading this now, you should.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 28, 2014
												Unless you like playing a single player game with an MMO grind, I would not recommend this to anyone who likes games for the community.Vindictus' Achilles' heel is its match-making system. This game is a lobby game that provides a market, PVE, and PVP, yet you can't join other people's PVE stages in-session like Warframe and you're not even allowed to do something productive as your PVE party forms like in Dungeon Fighter Online. In Vindictus, as you form your party, you are confined in an instanced area that provides nothing productive other than a punching dummy, a general vendor, and a mailbox. You end up getting people who don't want to form parties hence people who can't get parties. For comparision, imagine being forced to do nothing in WoW as you queue up: you can't work on professions, browse the auction house, go do other quests, or even travel. How often would the WoW's community queue with such an absurd confinement? Warframe was pretty shallow when I played it and DFO Internaltional was shutdown, yet they at least didn't waste your time as you queued for parties.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 26, 2012
												Pretty damn good for a free game. In a lot of free games you almost HAVE to buy "optional" stuff in order to play, not in this one. Most of the shop items are for looks, or little boosts that you can get in the game anyway. The game itself is kind of like a Monster Hunter game. The fact that this is done on the Source Engine is really astonishing...it looks and feels like something done on a mainstream engine, such as Havok. When I got this I was expecting some clunky rpg to burn spare time on and then toss in a couple weeks after a good game came along, but this is actually a very well done game.Pros:-It's not the kind of f2p where you have to spend real money in their shop in order to play it.-It looks good and feels good, like a mid-level game done out of a big studio (like Capcom).Cons:-It's an mmo, so no single player offline, of course.-There has been a bit of lag, likely due to all the new Steam traffic (but it should die down after the casuals get bored with it).

content:
Posted: July 30, 2014
												Great game, I love it!  Vindictus is very well balanced, and not even slightly pay-to-win.  Though the economy is a bit difficult to wrap your brain around at first, but just take a look at a guide or two and it's easy as pie to get LOTS of money REALLY fast.Gameplay is simple, yet satisfying in a way; though you will have to go on the occasional grind for mission completion.  Good leveling system and unique skills to unlock, it's really easy to figure out and play.  I'd definitely encourage anyone to play this game!Edit:  It has come to my attention that I am not nearly as experienced enough in this game as I thought I was.  The above description really only applies until some of the later levels (about lvl 60), and the economy begins to  crash on you:  weapons and equipment are over priced, not enough people are selling/buying resources to craft higher level equipment for cheaper, way too much grinding, and whatnot until you have to result to using real money to progress through the game.Basically, this game is only worth playing if you like grinding and probably giving up later in the game.  Fun at first, not so much later.

content:
Posted: August 13, 2014
												This is a fast pased action mmorpg, far better than anything else out there.  Yes, it may be a dungeon crawler with no open world atm, but don't let that hold you back from experiencing this simply amazing game.  It's combat system is extremely involved, you decide if you get hit or not with your own timing, you decide if you can land that attack in time, not some stupid RNG.  New character classes being released every 6 months, we are at a total of 8, each offering a very unique play style.  Nexon has really setpped it up as of late, greatly improving the game's stability and are becoming very consistant with content updates.  I hope you give this game a try, it's more than worth the download!

content:
Posted: February 14, 2014
												I played this game before it was even on steam. This game takes aspects from two of my favorite genres. It has skills and classes from a typical MMORPG, but then in the combat it takes on aspects of a live-action MOBA (non-rts) style. I would highly recommend this to both casual and hardcore gamers due to its high  potential and tactics when fighting harder enemies. The beginning of the games is slow though, enemies are easy, no one has any troubles, and typically it feels like a grind-fest. However once you get further in the game and get a more in depth touch, you really get engaged in the fast paced, high action, and VERY difficult boss fights.

content:
Posted: September 17, 2014
												This game is actually one of the Better MMORPGs I have played in all my years of PC gaming. From the astonishing graphics, to the fairly good optimization, to the story itself, it is a great game. Oh, and those animations? Amazing. Plus, at level 12, the Evie class gains the ability to use a scythe, which scythe-using classes are always a plus in games for me. There is, however, fairly bad population lag if you have and old CPU, but that's really nothing if you play on a less populated channel. I'd give this game a solid 9/10 rating, and highly recommemd it to anyone interested in True-Action, Dungeon-Crawler MMORPGs.

content:
Posted: March 1, 2014
												Beautiful game. Amazing storyline. Creative monsters. Prelude to my second favorite game made by Nexon.This game has the most beautiful artwork and concepts of armor I have ever seen. Each character is crafted as their own. While the facial features might be the same for all characters, it really doesn't matter when you can personalize any way you want from skin tone to make-up to even under armor. The characters move so in tune with their weapons nothing seems unnatural.The storyline is fantastic, especially because this is all a prelude to Nexon's Mabinogi. This game is much more serious than Mabinogi and it certainly gives you a break from the care-free enviroment of it, which is sometimes nice. The storyline I can keep track of pretty well with easy to remember names and (regretably) a very small map with 2 towns, one you are in 90% of the time. The monsters are your usual monsters, but with a little twist and have such amazing graphics and design to them. Gnolls are transformed and given clever names, ranks, titles and even abilities and stray from your usual dog-man creature. Nexon really nailed it on this one when it comes to 3D monster art.As I said before, this game leads up to Nexon's Mabinogi (which is another great game by them). This clears up some of the plot to Mabinogi and this is all around a good plot on it's own.This game is absolutely perfect for a gamer who loves running dungeons with an amazing looking character. If you aren't downloading this now, you should.

content:
Posted: February 14, 2014
												I played this game before it was even on steam. This game takes aspects from two of my favorite genres. It has skills and classes from a typical MMORPG, but then in the combat it takes on aspects of a live-action MOBA (non-rts) style. I would highly recommend this to both casual and hardcore gamers due to its high  potential and tactics when fighting harder enemies. The beginning of the games is slow though, enemies are easy, no one has any troubles, and typically it feels like a grind-fest. However once you get further in the game and get a more in depth touch, you really get engaged in the fast paced, high action, and VERY difficult boss fights.

content:
Posted: September 17, 2014
												This game is actually one of the Better MMORPGs I have played in all my years of PC gaming. From the astonishing graphics, to the fairly good optimization, to the story itself, it is a great game. Oh, and those animations? Amazing. Plus, at level 12, the Evie class gains the ability to use a scythe, which scythe-using classes are always a plus in games for me. There is, however, fairly bad population lag if you have and old CPU, but that's really nothing if you play on a less populated channel. I'd give this game a solid 9/10 rating, and highly recommemd it to anyone interested in True-Action, Dungeon-Crawler MMORPGs.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 11, 2014
												It's basically a hack and slash in the source engine. Sounds fun, but fails in a lot of areas.+Nice Graphics+Decent Combat Controls+Easy to learn combos-No real LODs for models. Instead everyone on the server looks like they're wear monk robes while they load for some reason.-Terrible, semi-unskippable text dialogue everywhere.-Little to no weapon variety. Your character usually has 1-2 weapon types they can ever use. Every weapon of that type is only an upgrade to the last, with no specialized versions.-Character customization is insanely overpriced. $30 for digital clothes alone. -You rent in game items for real money when you can't afford the permanent versions. Even when renting the prices are rarely under $7 for a week.-Ads for you to purchase in-game items everywhere.-Absolutely no exploration at all. You never really get to go anywhere. Just tiny town with 4 buildings, to a boat, to a series of rooms where you hit things until they die.-Assets are overused for enemies and levels, making the whole thing feel very lazily made.The only reason I play this is because I can't get my friends to play anything else yet.

content:
Posted: September 18, 2014
												I used to play Vindictus a lot and it is a lot of fun. My sorceress was purely support before they redid how healers function and they added so much to the kit to make the combat aspect fun and engaging. Unfortunately the customer service is abyssmal with and I found myself hacked and in need of assistance. So I submitted a ticket for assitance and a GM was back to me within the hour and I collected all the relevant logs and details they requested and was left with a promise that the issue would be resolved and I would be back kicking gnoll butt in no time. 1 day...2 day...3 day...posted to the ticket asking for a follow up with no response...1 week...2 weeks...3 weeks...posted again as the issue was still not resolved...1 month...2 months...6 months...Vindictus is released on Steam but issue still not resolved and poked the ticket...8 months...9 months...1 year and 1 month later there is activity! A GM messages me to ask if this open ticket has been resolved yet. A quick check and I response that it has not. I'm told they'll get RIGHT on it...13 months...15 months...1 year 6 months later another GM messages me that they have seen no activity for the past year and I respond that I was told to wait for the ticket to be resolved before I resume playing. I then get a message that no suspicious activity was noted for the past year to indicate the account has been hacked.I respond back that the ticket is older than 1 year old and all the relevant logs and details requested by the original GM are already part of the ticket. I get a response that as no evidence of the ticket being hacked within the past year was discovered the ticket has been closed and marked resolved.So...NEXON customer service. Promise results...wait until they can't fix anything...call the issue closed without solving a thing. NEVER EVER GOING BACK.

content:
Posted: September 26, 2014
												I liked this game a lot for a while.   It plays like Dynasty Warriors, which I like.  There are a lot of quests to do and places to be.  BUT there is a strong pay-to-win feel with the cash shop, especially since you will die a lot in later levels.  That is where I do have issues, though; the later content.  The last missions CANNOT be solo'd and in fact require a full party (6 people) to defeat.  Solo players will not be getting far unless they are very skilled or overleveled (which is very easy, since you can buy AP caps in the cash shop and just max out all your skills).  Also, good luck finding people to help in the later missions, as most missions have little inthe way of rewards to encourage people to replay.  All in all, this was fun for a while, but unless you have a friends to play with, you will hit a wall and not progress.I will still recommend this game for the gameplay and story, but only hardcore players will get the full milage out fo this game.

content:
Posted: December 14, 2014
												I have never been sold on ANY MMOs, until this one... A friend of mine suggested it to me and I installed it expecting it to be a PAY 2 WIN mess... When I started it up, I was surprised that there was NO launcher, and an actual TITLE SCREEN! A TITLE SCREEN ON A FREE TO PLAY GAME! WHAT? THATS CRAZ- anyways, yes, the game has a title screen. I began to play and after a while I began to notice the extreme lack of money grabbing♥♥♥♥♥♥other FREE 2 PLAY games tend to throw at you. Ive played for about 5 hours and have only seen two offers to buy things with real money, and that was on a whole different page within a page. I honestly think this could be one of my favorite free to play games that Ive played in a while.Overall, a very good and challenging game.For a free to play, worth it.- Hey, this is an edit... about two minutes after I finished typing all of that.What makes this game good? Ill tell yah~One: Very little screen clutter (you know, all that♥♥♥♥♥♥most MMOs have, yah, this game has little to none at some points)Two: ITS NOT PAY TO WIN - Rejoice!Three: If I said it's good, and its an MMO, it must be good... (You know it, JARVIS.)

												I love the game-Its simple to play, hard to master-Each class has special abilities that allow for diverse play styles -Money transactions are purely cosmetic as most any gear or item is craftable or lootable (or is given to you in events)-Bosses are epic and some require real skill to beat (at least with certain characters)-Game has difficulty so it sort of encourages coop play-So far the community seems great-Encountered some texture glitches and lag but nothing worth whining about really-A lot of balance in items and moves that make sure you aren't a god (at least until high levels)-Skills are focused on micromanaging every aspect of your character (this can be overwhelming at times)All in all I recommend the game and you should play it

content:
Posted: March 27, 2015
												This game.. Where should I begin. I've been playing Vindictus since early beta and I've loved it since. The "hack-n-slash" combat that people generally expect isn't what Vindictus offers. It offers a much more immerse type of combat. Every class has its' own unique gameplay.I'd give Vindictus a 8/10, not a perfect 10 because of the amount of luck needed if you want to get a high-enhanced weapon. If you've already played enough to see how the enhancing system works, I'm sure you know what I mean. Also, it's a very "pay2win" style game. Extra items that are sold for real money, and usually give you a pretty big advantage over other palyers that don't spend money. Such as more items, exp, etc.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 10, 2014
												A Korean made MMORPG that focuses on free combat movement. Most MMOs I find boring due to the similarities in auto attacking and endless quests that seem to relate little to the storyline. Vindictus is allows the player to appreciate farming and lvling since the characters are controlled by you and the combat is free movement meaning there is no auto aiming. You have to have the skill and practice to fight well. Character customization is fairly good with a good variety of cash items in the game. It is a free game with the options of a cash shop. And for some reason the chests of female characters jiggle to an interesting extent while moving.

Within this sandwich, many years of potato famine have unfolded into a crypt of secret paper that lead to the traffic cone of freedom after I forgot to turn my pizza maker into the one who seeks the holder of the vault. One day, justice will rain. Tittays.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 25, 2016
												I absolutely love the action combat of this game because it requires precision and strategic approach to most of the Hero Mode bosses/raids but allows you to just spam click your way through everything else for the fun Hack 'n Slash aspecs of this genre.  Dodging attacks is pretty easy for most classes but some are unlucky in not having any invincibility frames in their dodge when wielding certain weapons but for the most part all mobs/bosses give plenty of tell-tale signs of which kind of attack is coming.     There are many different kinds of weapons that have very different play styles and most of the gender locked classes can wield two types, which are unchangable during missions but can be freely swapped everywhere else.  Many different types of enchantable gear to upgrade your characters with [jewelry, standard armor pieces, costume parts with stat boost, etc] but &^$%, Forge Upgrading your armor/weapons past +6 is aggravating, and forget about +10 and higher unless you're filthy rich.     To be honest though, as much as I love this game, I find it very rage inducing due to these few reasons:  Dodging and attacking, Equipment Random Number Generator and Enchanting.  The dodging and attacking around bosses can be really fun but sometimes a few mistakes will cost you an expensive self rez item, especially if you don't want to wait 24 hours to refight the special/raid boss for a chance of a high valued drop.  Other times you'll find that team mates will kite a bosses incoming attack haphazardly which makes the whole 'unlucky positioning' a regular thing unless you just try to dodge everything, whether aimed at you or not, causing the overall fight to take longer.  The random number generator for upgrading/finding quality gear is standardly unfair unless you spend real-life money to prevent your gear from being destroyed on failed attempts.  The same can be said about finding and using the Enchantment Scrolls which makes having optimally Enchanted-Enhanced Weapons, Armor and Jewelry an annoyingly difficult and arduous task to complete.  Overall though its a game I've enjoyed plenty for extended periods of time and after long breaks as well.  I highly recommend giving it a few plays.

content:
Posted: October 26, 2014
												Although Nexon's "Mabinogi" MMORPG title has more of an original and unique feel to it, Vindictus has its ups and downs. I adore all of the games that Nexon makes, especially that of Mabinogi and Maplestory. I have put a lot of hours into Vindictus and was a beta tester for the game.Throughout the years I have come to the conclusion that this game is for the type of people who want hack n' slash ability and yearn for a-lot of carnage. The online servers have a few bugs but other than that, people who enjoy totally annihilating your opponent and/or having fun with friends, it's a good idea to try this game out. Totes fun.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 22, 2013
												This MMORPG is yet another great example of the free-to-play niche. The game is stunning, full of vibrant charm inspired by Korean-Japanese culture and European middle ages. What you have here is a massive package of free content. The game let's you pick three different fully fleshed out playstyles from the hard hitting sophisticated art of magic and alchemy to the brutally accurate archer.  There are tons of missions to partake in, a load of different weapons and armors with impressivly great design to choose from as well. A fully realized upgrade and leveling system is also present. The combat is real time and stylishly brutal! The music is also great! If you like RPGs then this game is more than standard fare. Try it out if you're interested, it's extremely fun and free! You've got nothing to lose!

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 24
												I have been waiting for the right time to leave my review and because of RECENT CONTROVERSIES, today is the day I do it.The good: CombatEasily the best out of every MMORPG, nothing comes close. Graphics.Pretty good graphics considering its age. At one point, the lighting/reflections in this game was the best I've seen. In fact, it rivalled AAA titles back in ~2010 when DX11 was uncommon. Music.Music is great, some of the best instrumentals I've heard. When I quit this game, I'll be listening to the OST into the far future for sure. Reasonably bugfree.Bug fixes may a take a while, but they eventually arrive.The bad: FPS and Client/Server instability.It is impossible to have a solid 60 FPS and the game crashes for no reason. Optimization is urgently needed but that appears to be low priority. The crashes are few and far between, but it is worth mentioning. The anticheat software is unreliable as proven by the abundancy of bots and for some reason it occassionally uses all of your CPU. Nexon NA.Official forums are heavily moderated. Seemingly normal posts get deleted because of "FUD" (fear, uncertainty and doubt). The definition of this appears to depend on the weather. I heard the anticheat software can trigger false positives, which means players can get permanently banned for no reason. Somewhat pay2win/pay2progress.You can obtain almost everything for free if you grind enough, but real money helps a lot. The game has high upkeep if you want some of the nicer things such as hair and extra inventory space.So, after about 10000 hours I'll probably play in a different region, quit Vindictus or quit MMORPGs entirely. At the end of the day, the game is good if you want to bash some monsters into the ground. But is the combat good enough to make people stay? Give it a shot, I somehow played this game for 10000 hours while hating it the entire time.

number of helpful: 18 of 36 people (50%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: August 22, 2014
												I've played Vindictus since the start of OBT. I've played the game for many hours throughout these few years, and I must say that this game is by far the most addictive game I've ever come across with. With that said, here are my pros and cons.Pros:Hack and Slash - This game is unique in game-play with it's hack and slash mechanics. I have played many hack and slash games, and I can say none of them compete well with Vindictus. It's battle system has kept me playing for years. It's combos gave me a rush of dopamine from the get-go. I got hooked, and it felt good. Character Diversity - Each character has it's unique play-style. Currently, you can play as 8 characters. Lann, Fiona, Evie, Karok, Kai, Vella, Hurk, Lynn, and soon Arisha. Each character is unique in battle. Even while Vella and Lann share the same weapon (Twin Swords), they feel very much different from one another. I've tried each character, and can see similarities among them, but they stand out on their own.The Abundance of Channels - Each Server has a total of 200 channels. Whether you want to interact, or play alone, channels provide a spot for everyone. The Story - The story is beautiful. I will not explain it, I don't like giving story spoilers. I will say, this game would be an amazing anime.Cons:RNG - Of course, this will be my first con to list. The RNG (Random Number Generator) of this game is very broken. You want to gear up, and enhance as best as you can? Gear enhancement can be very, very risky. After +6, you will risk the enhancement to 0, and after +8, you risk breaking.Some people have a lot of luck, and could possibly go from +0 to +15 in one go, but that's extremely rare.A lot of players resort to buying NX to buy Enhancement Runes to protect their arsenal.Over all, the RNG seems really unfair to everyone.Drop Rate - This goes along with the RNG. The drop rate sucks in this game, even with VIP, or VVIP services (which range from 10$ to 20$ a month) most of the drops end up being garbage.Server Stability - (Peer to Peer) - More times than not, I stay away from 24-man raids, and leave boats where the host only has 1 bar. Peer to Peer works great in Korea, but face it... North America is much more vast than South Korea.Bots - This game is infested with bots. These bots also inflate the economy, making things harder to earn.Depot Shop/Avatar Shop Pricing - The prices tend to be high up there. Though, you do not have to buy anything from these shops, people prefer to buy to look good, or gear up better. The game can have it's ugly pay2win moments.Recycled Dungeons - Perilous Ruins, Ruins of Sanctity, and Hilder Forest are the same maps. After a while, everything looks familiar, and dull. Prairie Entrance and Fomorian Base are purposely the same location. (Fobellow Prairie). That includes Ainle, and The Catacombs. (Night time, and Day time)Community - The community of this game can either be amazingly awesome, or terribly annoying.It ranges from down to earth people who actually play this game, to sorry people who try to tell you how to play the game, and act like they are a better person than you based on their numbers. Though, this is in every game, it's something one must learn to endure in MMORPGs.My Rating:Gameplay: 8/10Story: 8/10Server Stability: 5/10Community: 4/10Dungeons: 6/10Premium Shops: 6/10Overall Rating: 6/10.NOTE: Despite of my review and rating, I recommend this game. You should try it for yourself before you make any conclusions.

Who needs mats and recipes? $$$- All armor is grey scale with the exception of red and yellow sometimes.= Bye dye ampoules with a 1/6 to 3/6 chance to get the colour you want! Maybe!= Also, go buy some skimpy inner armor with NX! Sexy~+ More! Game hints pay to play, but it's free. I challenge you to get good without opening your wallet! It's possible, but very tempting.The game has a lot of pros too. I promise. Boobs.

												Although people claim that Vindictus is a prequel to Mabinogi some say it's related to mabi, some says it's a second mabinogi, well... lemme tell you this. Sure, I haven't put much hours in mainly because I have a crappy PC (but will be getting a better one soon.) But I'm not coming back to this from what I've been seeing from a lot of people. Just because there's Morrighan and Cichol(whoever the ♥♥♥♥ it is that's in Vindictus) doesn't mean Vindictus is the prequel or whatever. Also Mabinogi is a MMORPG Sandbox-ish anime life simulator. Although what people don't get, is this. [**Just because there's fomorians, and other Irish mythology that's the same in Mabinogi doesn't make it another Mabinogi game unless it's confirmed by Nexon or DevCat**] I highly give this game a 1/10 That 1 point is better physics and hit boxes. Anything else is garbage.

content:
Posted: June 6, 2014
												Vindictus is a fun game, but sadly its deteriorated into a pay2win game with horrible customer service. The game has been steadily losing population for the last year and Nexon doesn't feel like fixing the game since that doesn't bring in money. They are more focused on releasing Inner Armor for the females so people can clothe their waifus in bikinis. There is nothing in the game for low levels and grouping with your peers at low levels is basically non existant. What end game they have is a grind fest, and by that I mean it takes weeks to get a certain piece you need to improve your gear, and there is a good chance you will lose that piece of gear in the process. Don't waste your time, stay away from this game.

content:
Posted: January 24, 2016
												Basic:  Type:Hack'Slash  Graphics: Very Nice  Gameplay:Very Fun, and take time to improve skill and learn boss. 3rd person view, with basic combo and depending how you apply them on different boss is really fun.  Char: Each char has a very different playing style and each take time to learn.   Economy: Very, very bad at low levels or for new players. you won't make money until you reach near end game. There some bots and gold selling, but less compare to last year.  Players Base: The player base is low to mid. There is not a lot people playing on lower level maps, unless a new char is released or bots.  Char Looks: it cost real money to change your looks which is understandable to some point. If u play for a while you will get some events that allow you get free item that allow you to customize your look. AP shop can also be use. ( AP are point use to level up skill)  PvP:is near dead, becuase how unbalacne it is but its still fun.  Streamable: yes, but very hard to get views.  P2W: Not at all really, depend on your skill level and how much time you spend on the game to get gold.   Updates:It has good updates and reworks, beasue its is really pouplar in KR.Drepy:   I would say this game is good for solo players, fun learning the boss and make friends along the way. Nice game to play with a small group of friends to help you out and leveling up with you on lower levels. I would recommend you try to find a good guild that very socail and will to help you out on run. The player base is very poor, even on higher level maps. It is a very good game but it lacking player base. It takes  a lot of hard work and gold to reach end game stats.NOTE: This game is really HARD to get into if you do not put the effort getting to end game. It easy to put off for 3-6 months and comeback later (most players do). Try getting the starter packs if you are new (free if i remember right)

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 8
												(Steam Review)Nearing 200hrs of on and off gametime. This is your standard hack n slash BUT, the combat is by far the greatest any game may have. Every frame, movement, hitbox, phases are incredibly smooth and is what keeps this game alive (aside from the cosmetics which actually keeps it alive). If you're going to be an on and off again player I highly recommend putting a couple of points into Meditation. Although the time reduction may seem minimal it will definitely stack up over time. I haven't done the exact math on this but, there have been times where I've logged in and seen a nice chunk of AP waiting to be used. Pros: Free to play, progress at a steady pace, NOT A CONSTANT MOB GRIND (like Maplestory), Incredible combat mechanics, characters feel unique and have their own playstyles. Characters can be almost completely customized (free) down to their eyes, body sizes, etc... The solo combat outweighs the Cons but only by a slim margin. It doesn't matter what class you pick, the best class changes often with little changes put out. The new updates have made it so the game runs perfectly smooth on my PC where in the pass it has not.Cons of the game: Dungeons will feel very repetitive (I'm only lvl67 atm, doing Season 1 battle quests). The only fun moments are when I finally get to the boss or am in a raid. Player base is extremely low, you can indeed pay to win but I don't think it's neccessary, LACK of permanent cosmetic events, butchered Raids (I hardly see anyone doing the 20+man raids nowadays with their new system, I used to be able to que up and the notifier would actually pop up and tell me to join). LOCKED gender classes so everyone of ie: Kai class will be males.If Nexon put out more events for lower level players/new players the game would be able to get more traffic. The playerbase needs to increase to help the game out more than anything at the moment.

number of helpful: 7 of 14 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 22, 2015
												The game uses a "hub" system. Combat is instanced in small (and incredibly repetitive) areas. Content is recycled for about 20 levels all the way up to level cap, meaning for every twenty levels of play you're killing the same stuff, but recolored, in the same areas, either forward, or backward. Classes are varied, but they are also gender-locked. Some classes have a lot of similarity, but they simply created a female version because thongs sell better than boxers (no joke, females are basically barbie dolls to dress up). Content is plentiful, but experiencing and unlocking this content is a nightmare. You are expected to run the same dungeons over and over, and when you're not doing that, you're reading (or skipping) long, tedious storylines that you are only able to skip one dialogue sentence at a time (how long can your index finger or thumb mash on those buttons before they're just sore?).This means that even when they have Bonus EXP events, you will actually out-level the content that you're in. You are REQUIRED to play a lot of missions twice or more in order to fully "complete" the requirements to unlock the next mission. There are at least THREE LAYERS of restrictions on content, either "Completion" points, "storyline" completion or "character level". These three restrictions can be infuriating to deal with, since the majority of the content in the game (the normal story missions) can literally be completed in a matter of minutes.I am not joking when I say you will spend more time talking (reading text) to NPCs than you will actually doing missions. You will have to talk to one, two, three, four or more NPCs to learn about a particular mission, and then it will only take you about two minutes SOLO to complete said mission. Only exception to this is Raid Bosses. They are the only fun element in Vindictus, but if you play in a full party (there is no level restrictions, you can get hard carried in these raids) then you can normally get away with dancing in a corner doing nothing while your allies whipe the boss in several minutes.Another problem with this game is the business model. They've tried to be as fair as possible, but in the end what they've come up with is a system that heavily rewards paying users by giving them more exp, more loot, better loot, better consumables (potions you can drink while laying on the ground), more teamplay items (revive tokens etc) and just overall a better experience.Being a free player in Vindictus is tedious, tiresome and not necessarily rewarding. To be a free player you need to spend dozens of hours preparing for the next section of the game either by crafting, buying/selling on the market or collecting mats from dungeons. This process is incredibly time-consuming, and does not feel rewarding. Finally acquiring that "next level" set of armor is only the first part of the puzzle. You will craft items in random (and disquesting) colors so if you care even a little bit what you look like then you'll be obligated to proceed to the next part of the process which is customizing the color.If you do not buy things with real money you will literally be spending millions of gold (3.5mil approx for one color) to get the specific colors that you want. If you don't mind wasting time (and gold) you can roll for random colors for signifigantly less, but normally you will get hard clashing colors, desaturated colors, or poop brown. A lot of the time there is one item in the set that simply does NOT roll the same colors as the rest of the outfit, so you will have a clashing color no matter how much time and effort you spend rolling. Best bet is to farm gold to buy dyes directly from players. Unless you're fine with spending $3 to randomly get a color from six possibilities. Yeah, you read that right. $3 to gamble colors. That's Vindictus.The other things you can buy through the real-money store is essentially wigs and underwear. There is a "depot" that contains pets, consumables etc. and if you plan to be a serious Vindictus player then you simply can't get away with NOT buying from the depot.Casual players will want their characters to look decent, so they will likely want a wig and some underwear. $10 a piece. Why? Because breast physics and buttcracks. If you use the default, you'll have an ugly white cotton undershirt and shorts. Basically all the armor sets are designed WITHOUT these inner-armors in mind, so they will stick out like a sore thumb.With all of these things listed above I simply will not recommend this game to anybody, ever. The business model is awful and punishes free players in almost every possible way. The pacing of the game is incredibly inconsistent and painful (literally, my finger & thumb go numb when I play for more than 30 minutes) and the story is your typical Eastern Anime-themed "Oh noes I'm a diety but because I'm a helpless girl I need every strong man to save me from stupid situations" and frankly it drove me nuts. You're a member of a mercenary group and the amount of petty squabbles, incompetent recruits (and generals) and whatnot is just appalling. It's hard to believe that these people even know which end of the sword to carry.Don't bother with Vindictus. When it first came out it was basically the first Western MMO to play like this, but now we have different games that do the same thing in a much more fair and reasonable fashion (Tera, for example). This game will try your patience, hurt your fingers, frustrate you when it should be entertaining you. Unless you're a horny teenage boy or girl that likes looking up skirts, avoid like the plague.

content:
Posted: January 5, 2015
												The story and characters are bad bad bad bad bad bad bad. The writing is downright awful and so long-winded that I dreaded every time I finished a story mission because I knew what I would be subjecting myself to when returned to town. No amount of heavy drinking can make me give a single damn about any of these one-dimensional stereotypes and their emotional instabilities.But seriously. Don't read the story. Just click until it's over. The wellness of your soul is a stake.If you came for the gameplay, it's pretty decent. Some of the characters are unique enough to be interesting, but the levels are repetitive and clearing the way to a boss is boringly easy. On top of that, the late game feels sloppy and unbalanced. The easiest way around that is to hand Nexon tons of money. They love money.The final nail in the coffin for me is that the nighmarishly slow server lag over the past few months (Yes. Months.) has rendered this game fairly unplayable. It' too bad that I kind of liked it.Kind of.

There some bots and gold selling, but less compare to last year.  Players Base: The player base is low to mid. There is not a lot people playing on lower level maps, unless a new char is released or bots.  Char Looks: it cost real money to change your looks which is understandable to some point. If u play for a while you will get some events that allow you get free item that allow you to customize your look. AP shop can also be use. ( AP are point use to level up skill)  PvP:is near dead, becuase how unbalacne it is but its still fun.  Streamable: yes, but very hard to get views.  P2W: Not at all really, depend on your skill level and how much time you spend on the game to get gold.   Updates:It has good updates and reworks, beasue its is really pouplar in KR.Drepy:   I would say this game is good for solo players, fun learning the boss and make friends along the way. Nice game to play with a small group of friends to help you out and leveling up with you on lower levels. I would recommend you try to find a good guild that very socail and will to help you out on run. The player base is very poor, even on higher level maps. It is a very good game but it lacking player base. It takes  a lot of hard work and gold to reach end game stats.NOTE: This game is really HARD to get into if you do not put the effort getting to end game. It easy to put off for 3-6 months and comeback later (most players do). Try getting the starter packs if you are new (free if i remember right)

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 8
												(Steam Review)Nearing 200hrs of on and off gametime. This is your standard hack n slash BUT, the combat is by far the greatest any game may have. Every frame, movement, hitbox, phases are incredibly smooth and is what keeps this game alive (aside from the cosmetics which actually keeps it alive). If you're going to be an on and off again player I highly recommend putting a couple of points into Meditation. Although the time reduction may seem minimal it will definitely stack up over time. I haven't done the exact math on this but, there have been times where I've logged in and seen a nice chunk of AP waiting to be used. Pros: Free to play, progress at a steady pace, NOT A CONSTANT MOB GRIND (like Maplestory), Incredible combat mechanics, characters feel unique and have their own playstyles. Characters can be almost completely customized (free) down to their eyes, body sizes, etc... The solo combat outweighs the Cons but only by a slim margin. It doesn't matter what class you pick, the best class changes often with little changes put out. The new updates have made it so the game runs perfectly smooth on my PC where in the pass it has not.Cons of the game: Dungeons will feel very repetitive (I'm only lvl67 atm, doing Season 1 battle quests). The only fun moments are when I finally get to the boss or am in a raid. Player base is extremely low, you can indeed pay to win but I don't think it's neccessary, LACK of permanent cosmetic events, butchered Raids (I hardly see anyone doing the 20+man raids nowadays with their new system, I used to be able to que up and the notifier would actually pop up and tell me to join). LOCKED gender classes so everyone of ie: Kai class will be males.If Nexon put out more events for lower level players/new players the game would be able to get more traffic. The playerbase needs to increase to help the game out more than anything at the moment.

Posted: March 30
												Vindictus is a free to play third person Action MMORPG.  It worked on Win 10, looked ok, played ok, sounded ok.   There is PVP, but it is not worth playing.  Brutal action combat using Mouse/Keyboard or Controllers.   Pick any hero from 10 choices, each with a different choice of weapons and attacks.  Heroes are gender locked, you can change the costmetic appearances of the hero you choose.  Combat is mainly using left and right attack buttons in certain orders while dodging/ blocking / countering attacks from enemy using Standard movement. Travel to  Instanced dungeons with up to 3 players, with 3 difficulties.  Level cap is 90.  Check the wiki and guides for info how to play and maybe find players in forum. CONS:- Very low population of new players. - Very hard to find people to play quests with.- Very repetitive PVE.- The camera system is a little clunky using Mouse / keyboard.Try it, if you like Action Combat games.For more info:

content:
Posted: April 24, 2015
												A great game made by the worst MMO company in the History of online gaming called Nexon whom I will refer to as Shixon in this review.   Save yourself the trouble, and do not play this game it's a waste of time and money.Problems*#1.   If the vast skies were scrolls and the endless oceans were ink, I could not write enough bad things about any Shixon run game, this game is no exception.*#2Servers are absolutely horrible.   You wll get disconnected, you will lag, you will not be able to play the game properly no matter what server you are on.   The community has complained to Shixon about this, but it seems like they are unwilling to upgrade their 56k dialup internet connection.*#3Bots.   As with any Shixon made game, bots are a problem.   Not only do the millions of them that ruin this game cause severe server lag, but they also destroy the economy and other areas of the games completely.   Right when you first start playing the game on Channel 1, you'll be greated by Bots standing right in the middle of town trying to steal your credit card information by selling gold for cash.   Shixon has been unable to catch these bots even though they stand right in the middle of town yelling to everyone.   DO you think it's safe to give your credit card information to hackers?    Shixons lack of action against these bots shows that Vindictus is also a risk to your financial information and identity.   You might spend $100 on your credit card on premium items only to have some hacker spend $10,000 on your credit card for a vacation to another country.*#4Shixon.   This argueably should always be the first problem anyone mentions when reviewing a game made by this company.   This is the worst online gaming MMO company that has ever been formed.   *#5Poorly thought out events, drunk moderaters is the only explanation.    Imagine that you played the game for a year or so, we all know how these MMO's work.   You play the game and work hard to get your high level gear which can take MONTHS on this game.   The day you get your high level gear you realize that Shixon has decided to run an event which practicly gives new players the same gear you have, and for free.   What do you get for being a  level 85 player who contributed to the game since the start?   20 healing potions.   Yes this really did just happen.   Typical Shixon.*#6Unoptimized engine.   You can have a 5 GHZ (Turbo) 8 Core liquid cooled AMD 9590/Nvidia 660TI/OC and the game will still find random ways to stutter despite the fact that I can play newer games like Wolfenstein the New order on max everything at 1080P without a stutter or hitch.   This is due to a poorly optimized engine that does not use multiple cores what so ever at any point in time during playing.   Intel Cpus are better for this game due to the pathetic level of coding since Intel Cpu's are usually rated better on single threaded applications.The Good.This can be summed up in one paragraph, at the core this is a great action hack n slash game.   You'll play this game and say wow this is really great, this guy reviewing it must be crazy.    Then you'll keep playing the game and realize everything I said was true a month down the road and you'll instantly wish you had the last month of your life back.  Save yourself the trouble my friends, friends don't let friends play Vindictus.

content:
Posted: June 2, 2016
												Vindictus a game I've played in the past and continue to return in hopes of its improvement, only to be upset time and time again.The game has great potential, but appears to be lacking in many aspects that make it a game I would recommend. My highest characters are nearing their 50s, and I've gotten that far with 3 different characters. This is entirely based off of my experience and the experience of others I have played with. I have participated in some endgame content such as dragon raids, which I found to be fun even though I died a lot, but I will not be covering that in this review.Combat ++ Physics++ Classic Hack and Slash+ "Greater" Raids offer unique gameplay not seen as much in the Story+- Fun w/ killing your friends via the environment+- Spear Throw friend/foe (does no damage to friend)+- Fluid and seamless depending on your specs, server, settings- "Greater" Raids require 16 players to start- Repetitive use of Skills- Becomes more repetitive the higher your levelGameplay++ Limitless amount of AP (skill points) to spec every skill+ Gold is an easily obtainable resource+ Quests sometimes chain through completion (Doing one dungeon sometimes completes two quests)- Storage is Limited unless you pay and a lot of resources are necessary for quests/crafting- Linear Environment/Dungeons- Linear Quest Line- Linear Way to Kill Bosses - 1 Strategy is usually the most effective and used above all other strategies- Bosses an enemies do not vary much every 10 levels- Repeating the same dungeon more than twice - becomes more repetitve at higher levels- As you level drop rates on items for quests become lower- Upgrading is high risk or extremely expensive (RNG)UI+ Titles- Cannot View channel location of friends via friend list- Cannot View location of friends on the minimap- Cannot Search for Unadded Friends in Friend Menu- Emotes are hidden need to be googled- Marketplace/Guild Search appear to be quite slow and may be using Internet Explorer- Inactive Guilds die, leadership is not transferredCash Shop+ Some of the greatest quality and entertaining costumes and goodies excessible in the RPG world+- Nexon makes money primarily from costumes and so it appears to have become the focus of the game+- Almost every second patch has a new costume+- Wealth of a player shines, people will take their time to oggle you- Players more interested in costumes than the actual gameplay- Overpriced AND Restricted relative to other RPGs (common in many Nexon games)- A bum is still a bum if they enter this game, the costumes and cash shop content are promoted so much that many active players end up buying it and new players or those that cannot afford it feel pressured or distaste.Other+ Controls are fair, supporting 3 modes+- You use the same armor/weapon for most of the game- Bugs take years to fix- Sound quality is average- Music is repetitive- Monster cries, screams repetitiveLast thoughts:This is a game you want to play with friends, preferrably join a guild or create one for the exp boost when you party together. This game a lot of perks to group play, but is not as rewarding to solo players.

												Quick Summary: Vindictus for PVE grinding only. Classes are imbalanced and heavily gear dependent in PVP. Grinding involves RNG drops, meaning that you might have to do an instance many times to get what you want. Enchantment system is pure RNG, with chance to downgrade your enchancement level once you go past +10. Cash Shop items can prevent this. Endgame PVE revolves around Raids, where you have to get meet certain DPS benchmarks to even be considered for boats.Did i also mention overpriced cosmetics and pervy underwear?Lag and recent Optimization quirks will make you rage sometime. WTB Lynn buffs.In the meantime I'm heading off to play Black Desert Online which is like the Sandplot MMO version of Vindictus only without (p2W) enchancement cash shop items and with an added addition of Open World pvp and GvG.

content:
Posted: August 9, 2016
												Terrible U.I. combined with obnoxious dialogue from the characters. I dislike how interacting with vendors works as they simply pop-up when you're near them instead of you being able to choose to speak with them. Chat spammers you can't ignore because you can use buy "Megaphones" that can't be blocked unless you mute the person speaking which at that point is meaningless. There's a lot of important settings missing such as a volume control for ambient sounds and NPCs. This is important because when you start up the game you're placed on the main menu which has incrediably loud roaring wind, then once you're past that onto selecting a character there's another incrediably loud narrator speaking giving discriptions of characters who you're also unable to quiet down. The only way to sell items for gold is through a global market place, no selling to NPC vendors which is another terrible flaw in the game. It only serves to keep newer, lower level players down while the rich get richer. The gameplay itself is quite fun, so I still reccomend trying out the game. I'd also reccomend using a controller, it certainly improved my experience.

												How the hell did Nexon go from Maplestory to this XDIn all seriousness, its not that bad of a game, there are a few things that prevent it from being amazing (Like many mmo's, its a tad bit p2w, and they made it harder for people who want to get things for free to obtain ingame currency, as gold is only rewarded on the highest difficulty setting, which has to be unlocked).Other than that, the action is pretty great, and playing as Hurk...well, lets just say I've never felt like I was playing as Guts from Berserk until now. A solid 7/10.

												I had spent (I believe) thousands of hours on this game and I very much recommend it. Especially if you enjoy instance-based mmos opposed to open-world, and prefer running raids to grinding.They made it recently easy to get good equipment easily and reaching the end-game's become rather fast - though I believe that's what leads to the game becoming easily boring, because the end-game is pretty much just running a couple of stuff all over without the immersion an open-world would offer. This game is therefore best enjoyed if you're tagging along a handful of friends (instead of pugs). Unlike most of the mmos you don't run here a "balanced party", all characters/"classes" can "carry" and aren't dependant on other players/"classes". The content's being updated here and there and I find the game worthy of returning to on occasions. I don't see this game much as of a 24/7 material, rather something you return to when you need a break. I've been enjoying the newest bosses' fights as usually it tends to be something fresh.+ recommended for the story, high character customization (lots of items), actiony and fun combat, a bit of challenge if you play solo- problems are mainly bad optimization even with good hw (I gave up and play it on lower resolution for stable fps), frustration because of possible latency problems if you don't host raids, probably a lower immersion unlike open-world games, not very large player base (publicly hosted raids usually aren't many - on EU at least)

content:
Posted: December 29, 2015
												I've been playing this game for like four years now, and it's still one of my favorite Free-to-Play games on Steam. It's one of the few games out that lets you play through the entire game without paying a cent. It's becoming kind of a shame more people aren't playing it, because it could use the love.This game plays pretty much like a "hack and slash" game. The combat is probably the greatest thing about this game, it smooth and it just works. I'm surprised there isn't a whole lot of other MMOs that use combat like this. There is ten characters right now, nexon releases a new one every year, all of them have there own little play styles that's fun in one aspect or another. The game essentially plays like this: You run missions through a linear dungeon, fight enemys, and there's a boss at the end. A lot of the emphasize in this game is the Bosses. I like to compare some aspects of the boss fights to the "Monster Hunter" games since there is a lot of dodging and attacking if you don't know how the boss is going to move. At first though your probably just going to beat the heck out of the early bosses and leave. The game doesn't really ramp-up difficulty that much til around level 50 or 60ish, which really doesn't take that long to get a character to level 60 if your enjoying the game.The people who still play the game mostly seem to focus on higher level raids, which you can still find a party decently if you need one. We could really use more players though, but I suppose since this game is five years old you can only expect it to die off a little. Most of the major problems with the game is from the occasional bug nexon doesn't seems to know how to fix, or the lack of players when you want to specfic raid.Here's the fast version:PROs:+Great hack and slash combat+Unique characters that all have different interesting play styles+You can play all the content of the game without paying a cent+Pretty fun bosses+Lots of good replayable raids+Has a pretty good story if you bother to read the dialogue.+Level progression is pretty fast until around level 70ish+Pretty decent looking armor and weapons+Great character customization if you bother to put the time or money into it.CONs:-Somewhat of a lack of people for raids at times-The occasional bug shows up every once in a while (since Nexon doesn't seems to be able fix stuff very often).-After you finish all the missions there really isn't a whole lot to do except repay raids, and other missions.-Can be repeatitive at times if you don't like re-runing missions-A lot of the people who do the main high level raids sometimes have ridiculous attack requirements, which can be a bummer for people who don't want to put a lot of time at the end-game phase.-If you want anything customizable outside of what they give you, your probably going to have to pay for it.-Nexon "seems" to care about the community, but doesn't really seem to do a whole lot. They at least keep the game working alright.-Some of the weapon/armor enhancing, and enchantment scolls can become kind of stupid at higher ranks cus you can break your gear, which at high levels can cost you a lot of gold if your not prepared.

I love the fast action reaction based gameplay, very fun.However..The game is unplayable with lag ~20-30% of the time.It's blatently obvious why too - hackers.Hackers and botters.Botting hackers.Check the god damned boats, naked lvl 30+ lanns insta-killing teleporting speedhacking on every boat.I've reported it several times, uploaded two videos of it on youtube.One copy-paste response from support.Do not support this game, bail now or don't start playing.Economy and server stability are both dominated by the botting hackers, ruins the game.I'd say it's not that bad, and in my opinion.. botters actually help the market for new players because it makes things available at a lower price.  But it ♥♥♥♥s higher level players in terms of farming, and it ♥♥♥♥♥ all over the chest of the server stability.How does nexon not have better detection/prevention?I mean I know there's bots in like.. world of warcraft right?  I imagine every game could have a bot designed for it, with minimal detection risk by adding non 100% optimal pathing, randomized routes etc etc to make it look human.But blatant insane hacking letting you one shot kill ANYTHING while naked?  Speed hacking? These things shouldn't be in the game first of all.. secondly they should be EXTREMELY easy to detect and ban the accounts/IPs.Wtf Nexon.

content:
Posted: July 3, 2014
												This game.  It has been out since 2010, I was a closed beta "early bird" access member.  I remember browsing mmo sites to the end looking for something that was click to attack and wasn't purely pvp like "rakion" when I had the chance to play it.The story in this game is fairly decent.  Everything comes together no matter how messed up the timeline may be.The game is heading in a good direction by trying to attract more players.  I look forward to what is to come.  They finally got their♥♥♥♥♥in gear and I'm right behind them with a game I can't seem to put down.  I've quit many times over these last four years myself.  I've been through all the phases of the game and if I haven't it means something new is out.  I have tried recruiting all of my friends in real life to come join me because the end game is much friendlier with friends.The combat system is based around normal attacks and smashes.  Each character as their own unique specials and everyone will eventually have two full weapon styles to play around with.  They are gender locked though.  Each character has their own backstory but everyone goes through the same thing.  Gear progression might not be so forgiving as you will either have to farm for it, or pay for it with in-game money.If you have spare time. Vindictus is something you should consider yourself playing.  I want to see this game become something it should have already been.

content:
Posted: June 3, 2015
												Please don't listen to any of the negative reviews. I Started playing this game like two months ago and have hardly met any of the problems that most people are complaining about. The game is not pay to win, With all the free items that you end up getting, if manage them properly you should have no trouble reaching endgame. The characters are all very unique, and each one could be considered a powerhouse if you are able to use them correctly. The game can be tough at time, but that's part of what makes it so fun. The people are all very nice on the east server, and one time when I was fighting a raid boss, a player was even giving away free items to the players that were able to beat the boss without dying. I ended up doing exactly that, and he kept his word. The people are honest nice, and very active. Some of the extra content can be a little expensive, but its not anything that you need. Its only certain hair designs and types of clothing. Its pointless to buy unless you want to make your character look nice, but still pointless, because as you continue to progress, you will find plenty of armor that looks great. You don't need any of the stuff that nexon is selling to really enjoy and beat this game. Its one of the best games ive played in a long time, and I don't spend any money to enjoy. The story is also easy to understand. Season 2 was a little weird at first, but as you continue to follow it you will soon understand what is happening again. So please don't let any of the negative reviews bother you. This game should not be judged without at least trying it yourself. It's one of those game that you might regret not playing if you don't at least try it yourself. You have to make your own opinion on the game, to see for yourself if it is truly fun or not.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 31, 2013
												I defintely recommend this game if you like infinite dungeon crawling, epic action-y fighting, and fine tuned character skill development! Vindictus caught my attention because of it's physics system, as you can pick up objects in your environment and throw them at enemies, or pick up enemies themselves in some cases and throw -them-! Almost everything and anything can be picked up and used as a weapon (no exaggeration there), and in the hands of a capible warrior, even a BROOM becomes the doom of some poor monster! You won't be disappointed in the dungeons themselves, as traversing destructible environments, traps, and finding secret treasures will keep you excited (until you realize that the dungeon batches are pretty much copy-paste) and the enemies know and use this environment to their advantage (archers will shoot the supports to bridges to make you fall, enemies will attack destructible pillars to make them fall on you, etc). The game is made with the Source Engine, so it really hits home how diverse this software can be when used in game development (it surprized me that a company could use the SE like this)!Each dungeon has a "batch" of levels that look the same pretty much every time, and the enemies in these batches are pretty much copy-paste but with different colors and sizes. That's kind of the story with most MMORPGS, but in most cases you won't notice as you're mowing down a crowd of them with your sword, spells, arrows, or large blugeoning instrument of your choice. The monsters are pretty much straight forward in most cases, but the bosses are a big highlight of this game. Most of the time they're massive, deadly, and faster than you are. If you don't keep on your toes, dodge, and attack at the right moments, then you're toast. It's intense and epic when going against those bosses! Unlike other Free-To-Play games, Vindictus has a VERY in-depth character skill system, where AP (Action Points) are used to level certain skills and in-game gold is used to buy new skills (no real money required at all). While choosing a class confines you to what kind of skills you can unlock, that's where the confinement ends. From there, you can level skills at your choosing, and really define your character. You'll just have to see for yourself just how many passive and active skills you can level up, because I can't list them all! To go against these tough enemies, you gotta have the right gear. Vidictus has a fully-fledged Market and Crafting system for just that. Crafting is pretty straight-forward (ingredients + other stuff= Product), but the Marketplace is really polished to serve the players the best it can. I can't quite remember how it's done, but the Market will make sure that no one can buy-up all of a certain item and resell it at an outragious price, so it makes sure that everything is balanced and fair (just like in a real economy). Making gold in dungeons is really well-balanced, and if you look under every pot and destroy everything in sight, gold will start falling out of the cracks! If you're really economically-minded, then making your first million in this game should be a breeze. Of course, there are options to buy weapons, gold, and other bonuses within the game with REAL money, but it's all completely optional. What's better, is that some of these items are given away to the player periodically by the game itself (holidays, special event prizes, etc) but will usually expire quickly. The fact that you can have access to these items occasionally, however, is pretty generous (if not a marketing ploy to get us to buy something). However, again, it's completely optional. I've played this game for a long while, had tons of fun, and not spent a dime!It's a Koren-made game, so there are some cultural references that you might not get if you're from another country, but the story and life of this game world will keep you chuckling, while at the same time drawing you deeper into mythos. You won't be disappointed if you're a gamer who values a great storyline as well as great gameplay mechanics!BIG recommendation from me! This game rocks!

content:
Posted: February 21, 2015
												I have to be honest. My initial thoughts of this game were pretty negative.  There are some things that I do not like about the game, but the positives far outway the negatives.  I'll start with the negatives. I'm not a fan of the way the story progression is set up. It's like a flashback to an old school RPG before character animations and voice acting was implemented.  I don't like having to read the dialogue from a tiny box next to a portrait of an anime character.  It can be pretty boring... which is why I have almost no idea what the storyline is about. It just doesn't keep my attention, so I end up skipping a lot of the dialogue.  Also, the character customization is extremely basic.  I expected quite a bit more, but was disappointed. It is possible to get better hair cuts, costumes, dyes, and armor, but it will cost you quite a bit of real life money. Needless to say, I'm not interested in paying money for in game underwear.  Lastly, I don't much care for the way the quests are set up.  It's not open world, which is kind of lame, so questing is different in this game. Each battle (this is what the quests/missions are called in game) is like a mini-dungeon that is replayable. It's replayable because each battle has a list of achievement-like side quests.  These reward you with gold and experience when you complete them.  So this is a completionists worst nightmare, or wet dream... I could see an argument for both.  None of the battles are too tough, even on hard mode, to finish alone, but the raids require a little more muscle.  So the positives.  The game looks decent enough. The graphics aren't spectacular, but they did a good job on the characters' looks. Especially the female characters. They look pretty damn great. The female characters' costumes would fit perfectly into every nerdy teenage boy's hentai fantasy.  The combat is pretty cool.  It took a little getting used to initially, but once I got it down, I liked it. It's a little big buggy at times when it comes to the dodging and parrying against enemies, but still a lot of fun. It sort of reminds me of Dynasty Warriors back in the day.  You know, before they made 57 remakes.  Overall, it is a pretty fun game. Definitely worth trying if you're even a little bit interested. Plus, its free. How the hell can you pass up trying a free game?  GET THIS GAME.
