content:
Posted: October 31, 2015
												This game is so boring. It is a repetitive mess in all of its levels. My friend says it stops getting repetitive once you reach a certain level. NO!! The game should have not been repetitive at all!! The levels should have been interesting and cool from the start, but they all suck.What it is like getting my 50th mission in this game.Gwyn: "Kill this minster for me."I look at the monster, it is a clone of a clone, of a clone. The bosses are the same and all the developers did was make them bigger or changed the color of them. And it is usually like that in any level.Now there are bosses at the end of the world(area...i don't know) that are interesting, but the game has to keep me interested because going through the levels to get to the final boss of the world is so boring!The only fun things for me to do in this game is this labyrinth, raids, and this boss rush like area(it is in a desert I believe). I can't do a lot of raids and trying to get into a group raid takes forever.I also want to say something about the missions in the game. They suck and for one reason only. Not the repetitiveness of them, the level requirements. I should be able to do the mission without needing that level to do the mission. This forces me to grind, and yes I know. There is grinding in other mmo, but I don't grind as much in those than I do in Vindictus. It forces me to grind and that adds more to the repetitiveness of the game.Now I like repetitive games, only if they keep my interest. Monster Hunter and Warframe come to mind. Monster Hunter has bosses that I would like to fight over and over because I want a cool armor piece and they are fun to battle. Warframe is very repetitive, but the gunplay is great, Warframe abilities are nice, and some of the missions are fun. Going through different waves of enemies, I like that. Killing all the enemies in an area, I like that. Vindictus is just run through different areas, kill the boss of the level(the boss looks like every other boss) and done. Nothing interesting at all, no random events. Nothing. Just more trolls and worms with teeth that come out of the ground.I can touch on how bland the game looks, but it is an old game after all. The portraits of characters are decent. This game is just boring though. It cannot keep my attention at all. I do not understand why my Friend likes this game so much. I told him that he would really love Monster Hunter, and he saw you had to eat to keep your stamina up. He doesn't like it because you have to eat. He is an idiot because you don't have to eat a lot. Just eat before a mission and you are all good. The only times you might need to eat is when you die because your stamina goes back to normal, but it is still manageable stamina to work with.That's it. If you love this game, good for you, keep playing it. Me on the other hand, I do not like it. I am level 47 and nothing interesting has happened yet. I am warning anyone else who gets this boring game.Now it is free, so people can download it to try it, but why wait for a boring game  to download?

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 5, 2014
												I'm redoing this review because of yeah, I'm pretty sure Nexon got up off their arses and did something.Everything about this game is near perfect. In order to make an income, you need to collect items and sell them to other players. That leaves you with your own thoughts on, "If I set this much based on the original value, will someone buy it in the amount of time it is up?" I have sold several things in few seconds of posting them, due to the rarity item and the cost based on the maximum and minimum. Now that leaves a problem, getting money to do so in the first place, as it DOES take a fee to sell. Farm, or if you can, get a friend to donate money to you. [Option two is limited to those who were led to this game by a friend, or who have a friend who already has a large sum of in-game currency.] And to those complaining about Nexon making you pay for things, they make you pay for cosmetics. They are not needed for the main story, nor are they needed for 90% of the sub-stories. Stop complaining about it, as it is a simple want for the items you are being asked to pay for. Fighting is great, perfect. It is easy at the start but as you get higher and higher into the battle sequences, you find it challenging and you have to work as a team. The community is great, nobody complains from what I've seen, and when it comes to teamwork everyone is top-notch. The graphics are great, but of course that does depend on the strength of your graphics card/computer. I have to set mine to low, but at medium they are what I would say "High" for a F2P game. If I were to call this game anything, it would be "Battle Simulation". Nexon made this game to focus on breaking the limitations of battle in most MMORPGs, and they did. There is no wait time for skills, well, of course for the ones that do really high damage. But combo's are based on you, added to your timing and precision to dodge and attack enemies while taking little damage as possible is also up to you. The trade could use a few touch ups, along with gold. But mainly, this game is near perfect, and I would reccomend this to anyone.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 27, 2014
												It'd be a good game if it wasn't an mmo. That being said, it's free so you might as well try it out. Getting through the main storyline won't require any $$$ from you.A lot of the negative things about Vindictus stem from the fact that it's an MMO, because most of the MMO aspects of it aren't great. Such as gearing up, which is a nightmare. Grindfest AND a chance based system? It's a little much and most players won't even bother, leaving those who do feeling superior to the rest of the population. It's a lot more enjoyable when you're with friends who don't judge you based on how much $$$ you spent. That being said, you don't really need good gear to have fun. It's a skill based game, gear is simply there to subsidize a lack of skill. I've seen people solo 8-man lv 60 & 70 (end game) content naked. This fact is the main reason I'm recommending it. That and it's free so even if you don't like it, who cares? Uninstall it and no harm is done. As a side note: some bosses discourage players who stack gear. For an example, arguablly one of the hardest bosses about a year ago, Keaghan, has an attack cap of 13.8k. So all the 20k att the wallet-warriors get screwed. A lot of the newer bosses encourage teamwork over DPS, like Bark No.1. Also, an upcoming boss, the succubus queen, has attacks that ignore defense completely in addition to being unable to revive in any way (even goddess graces, the paid method).The storyline is probably the best I've seen out of a F2P mmo.. ever. They really give all their NPCs a personality and if they die (which some do) you actually feel something. It's too bad the voice acting is terrible, but the way you get quest dialogue 90% of the time is reminiscent of graphic novel games. The graphics are of course outstanding, I don't think screen-shots really do the game justice. You can see your characters breath. If you're in a cold environment you see mist form around their mouth between each breath. If you run out of stamina they get a tired animation. Everything is very fluid and seems natural up until the source engine's clipping issue. If that doesn't bother you than you'll be hard pressed going back to the AAA mmo's with comparatively terrible graphics.I see a lot of reviewers don't mention it, but the soundtrack is absolutely outstanding. It becomes especially apparent in raids. The music really enhances the whole game and I strongly encourage any prospective players to check some of it out on youtube.As for events, the majoritoy of them are quiet silly and some of them really give you some valuable items which you'd normally have to pay a lot of money for. An example of a silly one, is they had a valve cross-over event with TF2 and portal characters making appearances. Which introduced funny titles like "pwn'd by GLaDoS" and ..interesting hats like the headcrab. A recent even gave out +10 coupons for free, simply for being logged on.All in all, if you can get past the mmo nasty-ness and nexons continuous attempts to get money out of you, it really is a great game.

content:
Posted: August 9, 2015
												Before I begin, I advise that if you're an Aussie to not even bother with joining the Australian server, it's dead, the economy is dead, nobody plays and the only people that do play are afk people (so I guess they're not really playing, lmao). Instead, hop straight on to US West server, good connection, lots of people and their market is booming.Pros- Outstanding story line- Plenty of different armours to aquire - Same with weapons- Bosses / Raids- Each boss has a different attack pattern, keeping you on your toes.- Always this feeling of "What's next?" - Combat is FLAWLESS- Not really heavy on your connection because when you start a dungeon, it runs off of your connection (you're the host) so if you have good internet you'll never lag, besides joining other peoples partys where the host has a bad connection (not the game's fault though)Cons- Have to pay for more storage space- No bank (besides guild storage and you have to pay 300k to make a guild)- Combat skills can be confusing, I feel as how they explained the skills is pretty confusing (you will get the hang of it eventually though, just a pain to start out with)- Leveling things such as tailoring, armoursmithing etc can be pretty grindy, even for someone like me who absolutely lives for the grind.- Not exactly beginner friendly, not too many tutorials and stuff in game to help the new players (but, you will get a hang of it eventually if you just stick with it).All in all, this game is very enjoyable 8/10.

content:
Posted: August 9, 2015
												Before I begin, I advise that if you're an Aussie to not even bother with joining the Australian server, it's dead, the economy is dead, nobody plays and the only people that do play are afk people (so I guess they're not really playing, lmao). Instead, hop straight on to US West server, good connection, lots of people and their market is booming.Pros- Outstanding story line- Plenty of different armours to aquire - Same with weapons- Bosses / Raids- Each boss has a different attack pattern, keeping you on your toes.- Always this feeling of "What's next?" - Combat is FLAWLESS- Not really heavy on your connection because when you start a dungeon, it runs off of your connection (you're the host) so if you have good internet you'll never lag, besides joining other peoples partys where the host has a bad connection (not the game's fault though)Cons- Have to pay for more storage space- No bank (besides guild storage and you have to pay 300k to make a guild)- Combat skills can be confusing, I feel as how they explained the skills is pretty confusing (you will get the hang of it eventually though, just a pain to start out with)- Leveling things such as tailoring, armoursmithing etc can be pretty grindy, even for someone like me who absolutely lives for the grind.- Not exactly beginner friendly, not too many tutorials and stuff in game to help the new players (but, you will get a hang of it eventually if you just stick with it).All in all, this game is very enjoyable 8/10.

content:
Posted: June 23, 2012
												It looks awesome at first. The combat is completely different than any game you have ever played (negative as its clunky and hard to use at times). They use AMAZING graphics though, with smooth animations. Beautiful cutscenes are made for this game. However other than the combat, the way that quests are complete and the landscape is played out is terrible. For quests you go to a board and pick up a dungeon (solo or party). from there you go into a dungeon. A small variation of creatures from what i've seen and all of the dungeons look simiar or the same at times too. The environment is closed so not much freedom is allowed. This game is nothing like Skyrim or WoW if thats what it looks like.Its a whole different thing from those games but still has some good RPG elements. Worth a try, a friend to play with is recommended. 6.5/10 from me

Posted: May 6, 2015
												This thing is so poorly optimized its ridiculous. Its nothing like the video describes. The graphics look good but, it looks like they tried to build a game with a low budget, all purpose, graphics engine and it wasn't opitmized at all. The game play wasnt all that captivating either. The quest menu, character menus and NPC interfaces need to be dumbed down to match the simplicity of the actual game mechanics. In the end you get a quest, go to some bulleten board, load up a crappy instanced sailboat. Then you launch into a 10 minute map where you hack slash some generic monsters from an early 90s quake 2 type game and get some loot. All of which is pretty much designed to get you to buy stuff from the cash shop.This does not, as the video says, "crush" Warframe by any means.

content:
Posted: April 4
												First of all, IGNORE my steam hours, i have played the official client before the Europe launch as the global client and steam version wasnt there at that time.Vindictus was the best hack-n-slash game i was able to play without being bored of grinding, even if you dont get gold or anything but items such as quest items and mob drops needed later on or needed to sell for $, it kept me ingame for a good time everyday and the fight style was better than the Tab-Target system one.I will be reviewing this game possitive because i found only some scratches back then and some new ones now(cons section below) and i actually recommend you give it a shot, at least 1 hour of gameplay(depending of the class you chose) the game can keep you in the community or not.*PROS*-Great graphics with great fighting system.~Dungeon system that is a bit different everytime so you wont get bored of the enviroment.~Good-ish FREE TO WIN item system: By free to win i mean that, if you want to win pvp or fights easyer, you dont need to invest huge amount of money into it, just time and grind, a lot in some cases, but it will be worth, you can get by luck and some gold spent the same items as a *Noob* spends real $ for it. AGAIN, all depending on the grind and luck youve got for enchanting and crafting.~HUGE time invested in boobs details and physics.*CONS*~Removed Jump? Why, i mean, why the hell would you remove the ability to jump-smash spiders and other mobs and look cool while you would do it? (tested on Evie and Fiona, Maybe on other classes works, idk YET)~Sometimes the mobs wont react to the dodge effect so they will still hit you(stupid thing if you ask me)~LOCKED 30FPS LIMIT? I mean, comon, i know my pc aint a beast but hell, at least let me unlock that limit so i can enjoy the game sometimes..~Party System sucks as if you create a party sometimes your friend wont be able to join saying that either one of you is offline to the other.~Space-smashing to skip the conversations... Yeah, if youre not in the story and you only want to play the game, you will smash the keys so you get to the action, a lot of people will react to this as its not an aspect of the game so imporant.. it is.This is all the stuff i can think right now but i can confirm that the game is fun until you get mad and rage quit :)

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 12
												This is not your typical free to play MMORPG. Vindictus has a lot of things going for it; semi decent graphics, interesting character classes, boob physics, creative enemy and armor designs, boob physics... But where this game really shines is it's boss fights, particularly the multiplayer raids. The boss designs get more and more creative as you move along, with enough variation in each battle to keep you coming back for more. Having other players fight alongside you really provides a sense of camaraderie rarely seen in multiplayer games these days, especially in free to play games. This game is not perfect, the story is boring, the characters are flat, the menus are needlessly complicated, and some of the reuse of stages gets particularly annoying, but I find myself coming back for the creative boss designs and action-packed multiplayer raids, as they're just that fun.

content:
Posted: December 26, 2012
												This game, has been a wild rollercoaster, this game used to be very bad on events and everything, like very awful. They've gotten a new director for Nexon's Vindictus NA branch and they brought last month a great event full of free items and free NX items as well. If any review has "EU" or "European" in it, don't bother reading it if you're planning to play NA because that stuff really won't apply to you.Without further ado, let us begin this review.+It has an original combat system for an MMO and doesn't really rely on skills being used 24/7 for most classes.+The graphics aren't that bad for it being a Source SDK Base 2007 game.+Controls are easily customizable for if you have a gamepad, mouse and keyboard, or a controller.+Events have gotten better now, so expect in the future better stuff from events unlike previously.+If you know the term Fashion Souls; that applies to this game as all of your gear can be fused to look like another set and be dyed to look certain colours with the dye ampoule system.-Has a terrible anti-cheat system, people have been banned for false positives of "third party programs" when it was just another game that they probably had running.+Every character has a role in the game, and is unique and different from one another.+Customization of how your character looks, hairstyles, how tall they are, how much muscle or fat they have; their makeup if they're female; tattoos, hairs, and inner armours(No stats added) [There will be another point on this below in the cons]+Uses market place transactions where the prices are always fluxuating; something one day could be expensive, and in a few days it could go down in price etc.+Bots don't really exist on the NA West servers from what I can tell, dunno about other servers.-Peer to peer connection system, so you have to gamble that you'll have good connection with the player hosting the raid/party.-Pay to progress, there is a lot of stuff that can help you skip the grind, but the only thing you can't skip is the level grind.-The RNG in Vindictus is horrid and painfully bad when it comes to enhancing weapons and enchanting gear as well [Take note of the con above, as you can skip most of the RNG with items from the cash shop.]-Updates are few and far between because the game is made by a Korean company, so the rest of the world gets content that is released in Korea about a few months later.-Cosmetics such as hairs, make ups, inner armours, tattoos, beards, and anything like that are cash shop items and cost money, or you can basically earn them by getting enough gold and buy airtight coupons off the marketplace-Marketplace prices can be skewed and have a cash shop item that puts your item at the top of the list as well, doesn't cost you anything to put up on the market.I give this game an 7.5/10; it's a well done game with some glaring issues, like the content updates being far and few between because it's a game made in Korea. But, overall, this game is worth giving a try.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 26, 2012
												This game, has been a wild rollercoaster, this game used to be very bad on events and everything, like very awful. They've gotten a new director for Nexon's Vindictus NA branch and they brought last month a great event full of free items and free NX items as well. If any review has "EU" or "European" in it, don't bother reading it if you're planning to play NA because that stuff really won't apply to you.Without further ado, let us begin this review.+It has an original combat system for an MMO and doesn't really rely on skills being used 24/7 for most classes.+The graphics aren't that bad for it being a Source SDK Base 2007 game.+Controls are easily customizable for if you have a gamepad, mouse and keyboard, or a controller.+Events have gotten better now, so expect in the future better stuff from events unlike previously.+If you know the term Fashion Souls; that applies to this game as all of your gear can be fused to look like another set and be dyed to look certain colours with the dye ampoule system.-Has a terrible anti-cheat system, people have been banned for false positives of "third party programs" when it was just another game that they probably had running.+Every character has a role in the game, and is unique and different from one another.+Customization of how your character looks, hairstyles, how tall they are, how much muscle or fat they have; their makeup if they're female; tattoos, hairs, and inner armours(No stats added) [There will be another point on this below in the cons]+Uses market place transactions where the prices are always fluxuating; something one day could be expensive, and in a few days it could go down in price etc.+Bots don't really exist on the NA West servers from what I can tell, dunno about other servers.-Peer to peer connection system, so you have to gamble that you'll have good connection with the player hosting the raid/party.-Pay to progress, there is a lot of stuff that can help you skip the grind, but the only thing you can't skip is the level grind.-The RNG in Vindictus is horrid and painfully bad when it comes to enhancing weapons and enchanting gear as well [Take note of the con above, as you can skip most of the RNG with items from the cash shop.]-Updates are few and far between because the game is made by a Korean company, so the rest of the world gets content that is released in Korea about a few months later.-Cosmetics such as hairs, make ups, inner armours, tattoos, beards, and anything like that are cash shop items and cost money, or you can basically earn them by getting enough gold and buy airtight coupons off the marketplace-Marketplace prices can be skewed and have a cash shop item that puts your item at the top of the list as well, doesn't cost you anything to put up on the market.I give this game an 7.5/10; it's a well done game with some glaring issues, like the content updates being far and few between because it's a game made in Korea. But, overall, this game is worth giving a try.

content:
Posted: June 10, 2016
												Haven't played for a while, but still felt the need to write my opinions. Anyways decent game, graphics focus on character models more than that of terrain, and the early levels are a slow grind of repetitive missions until you've spent some decent hours into the game. Once you pass the early stages of the game you reach levels that are more interactive and interesting than that earlier on. Just know before playing that you will look ugly if you don't spend time/money attempting to secure a decent outfit, and that time is required to reach the better levels, but it is worth it if you're into these types of games. Lastly I commend this game for being different from that of most mmo-rpgs seeing how levels are stages, rather than an open world environment, yet still manages to create skill based battles, requiring timing and decent equipment grinding. If you're new your best bet is to ask a high level player to help you and teach you the ropes.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 6, 2016
												One of the best combat systems even in today's gaming frontier. However, it's a VERY rough diamond in the middle of smoother prettier diamonds.  A diamond because the combat, graphics despite it's age, and the lore it has. Rough because of how unforgiving the RNG is in this game when you're attempting to min/max your character stats. Failures on high level weapon/armor enchanting/enchancing will lead to the destruction of said gear. RNG for material drops are no less rewarding. This is mainly due to being a korean made game where RNG is a large aspect in many games made in the country. Despite the RNG I still find myself logging back on to play. Feel free to give this a try, but be warned.I've played this game for roughly 4 years, but had to switch to launching via steam because the new nexon launcher is filled with problems and  nexon seeming just tried to shove it down the throats of players.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: May 28, 2016
												There are a lot of MMO's out there each with their own benefits and downsides, some good and some bad, but if you were to ask me about Vindictus, I'd probably say it's good... Really good.PROS:- The game has really good combat, you don't just press a button and then the attack happens, you actually have combos you need to do. (There are active abilities were you press a button and the attack happens, but you have to aim it and sometimes have to follow it up with something else) Also attack animation look good and are fluent.- Some options on weapons for each class, not stuck with just 1 weapon type. (ex. Karok = Pillar/Cestus - Evie = Staff/Battle Scythe)- Interact with the environment, collect resources, breakable/grabbable items.- THE LORE/STORY, I believe the story and dialouge are AMAZING! It was one of the reason I still play the game. (Kinda rip season 2)- Very little pay2win/play feature that are immediatly apparent to the game ( Immediatly apparent pay2win/play feartures would be Something that will CHANGE the game, like not being able to go to a certain area or equip armor because you need to buy a subscription / ticket with real money)CONS:- Each class has a gender lock on it so if the class is a male, you're going to be a male character. (This is a problem for some people)- Some stages you have to repeat, which can get boring / make the story seem odd (Killing the same boss 2 or 3 times... He's already dead the first time right?- Combat can get repetitve when trying to defeat big bosses or when you are trying to farm.- There is some RNG on some max level gear. You might be trying to add or increase stats, this can result in adding or increasing a stat, or decreasing a stat which is a waste of time, gold, and it ruins your gear.PRO/CON MIX (Thing I'm unsure of)- If you spend money on the game, the RNG factor is not as big of a threat as it would be if you didn't spend money. The reason I do not put this as a con is because all it does it just make you're enchanting faster. You can do all of this without having to spend money, it just takes more time and you have to be commited to the game (Now if your gear gets destoryed thats a different problem...). What i'm saying is that the game IS [[[NOT PAY TO WIN/PAY]]] in my opinion, but rather it IS [[[PAY TO LOOK COOL/PAY TO DO STUFF FASTER]]].MY OPINION: The game is [[[NOT PAY TO WIN/PLAY]]] But rather it is [[[PAY TO LOOK COOL/PAY TO DO STUFF FASTER]]]OVERALL RATING: 8.5/10 DELICIOUS

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 4, 2016
												When I picked up this game about a year ago I thought it was neat, I hadn't reached much hours before this review, but anyways if you decide to pick up the game this might be helpful in some way. Basically, I started the missions in the game, I was instantly grasped by the games combat, you literally break backs and can send the body flying to another enemy. The graphics are neat, but I didn't care about the story as long as I went to hacknslash my way through hordes of enemies, which was probably the high point for me. I also picked up a buddy along the way. He was around my level, and we stuck together for multiple levels, together we did missions until my computer broke because of a hard drive problem, and since it is an old computer I decided to buy a new windows computer. Ever since then I have never seen my buddy. Im sure most of you have experienced this in co-op games, you find someone that you start sticking around with and then just like that you never see him again. When I picked up this game I thought it was probably better than all those other free RPG's out there, so why not just play this? Im sure all those people saying its P2W are just too lazy to do the work they need to do to get what they want without paying, and trust me, as I have played multiple games that have a slow learning curve, if you don't P2W and get it like it was meant to be it will feel like you truly accomplished something, and you can go up to people and tell them that you are legit if you want, I bet they will feel more confident about reaching that goal you just set for them if they are a lower level than you, if its a higher level than you they probably won't care or will feel happy for you.

Maybe I'm just unlucky? or maybe there's not a lot of people.That's basically all I can find to complain about since I started playing back in 2013.Rating: 7.5/10 PS- I personally think there should be a matchmaking setting as an option to find parties instead of "Quick Battle" and "Party Search". Again, that's just my opinion.

content:
Posted: February 12, 2014
												The game's combat is pretty solid, it's combat in a game like this that you can't find any where else, Vindictus get combat right. Dodging, blocking, countering, ETC. The game has it's problems like every game does, but really, no game is ever perfect, there is always♥♥♥♥♥♥to fix, and things to keep updated. Other than that, the game is pretty fun, you won't find fun in a game like this any where else. You can customize your character, you can still make the character you choose stand out from everyone elses, if you choose to. If you are into cosmetics in a game like this, making your character stand out, you will have to pay for it, but it can be worth it in the end. There is basic character customization, but everything else you may have to pay for. In other words, the game gets FREE content from time to time, per say a new character, or area to explore and fight the bosses at the end of it and "Raids," and hopefully fixes to glitches, and optimization.

content:
Posted: March 26, 2016
												Don't you dare. Do not click install. Don't. DOOOOON'T.This game. I know this game well. Like how well I know that ♥♥♥♥♥ down the street. Like with that strumpet, I wonder if I'm ploughing her or if she ploughs me. Judging by my super-AIDS i assumed the latter. This game will trick you into thinking it's really fun. Because it is. The combat is fantastic. I love it. But absolutely everything else about this game is God-awful. When you start out, it seems really fun. Then you get to the gear and stat grind. It's so bad. It's so damn bad. Nexon took a gem and tossed into a poop pile. 150 damn exquisite iron ores. Me and the other warlord of my clan decided to try out vindi again for the sick♥♥♥♥♥raid bosses, since warframe was being DDOSsed. We are towards the end game now, and holy crap FORGET exquisite iron ore. Most armor sets or weapons require an extraordinary amount of how high level ore. Iron comes from speckled turds in the instanced dungeons. One or two spawn. In season 2, u have a chance at getting lowest tier, second tier, third, or low chance at exquisite ores. Usually second tier drops. It requires 4 third tiers to craft exquisite.These sets require a total of 150 damn exquisite ores, among 20 count drops from raid bosses that are only dailies. Then their is the horrible enhance and enchant system. It's recommended to get a weapon to plus 8 to be any kind of viable. From +5-+8, the percent of success goes to 50%, to 40%. Failure resets rank to 0 and lowers durability, and takes the stones (more grind) you used. Buuut if u buy nexon cash, you can get runes that prevent those effects upon failure. No way to get nexon in game like Warframe btw. No discounts either. Enchants of a good rank only have 50% to 40% of success, but u can increase that by buying♥♥♥♥♥♥ Failure lowers durability and can break weapon for the good enchants. But guess what, u can buy a rune (nexon obviously) that saves your♥♥♥♥♥ Vindictus' gameplay is ♥♥♥♥ing fantastic, but the system built around it is ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t and promotes pay2win.At least you can get the parts for a frame in a day, at least formas and potatoes have NO failure chance, and at least you can get plat and resources BY PLAYING THE DAMN GAME.

number of helpful: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 19, 2016
												Its very much a "Its alright.. could be better" kind of game.-Gameplay is decent, although it could be improved, many mechanics just feel thrown in as a gimmick rather than being actually useful. -The controls are janky and sometimes annoying. -The camera would be better if your characters attacks weren't locked to it, I've had few collision issues which is good.-Visually its quite generic, I've had quite a few frame drops during combat which gets annoying.-Customization is insanely limited. You can barely customize your character and considering that is something I love to do.. its definitely a point taker.-Interactions and general exploration is limited and weirdly done. It feels like its trying to be an action-RPG like warframe or Path of Exile but has a bunch of extra UI elements that really dont need to be there.-As for UI/HUD, its quite basic, only really annoying when "in buildings" or trying to access different areas.Generally it has some interesting ideas, the 3rd person action-RPG style is cool and I'd like to see it done more, however the game seems to fail to actually deliver it in a really engaging way. Whether its Nexons fault or lack of enough production time is unkown to me, whatever the case may be its definitely something to look at, however I wouldn't spend money on it.

number of helpful: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 4, 2016
												One of the few things this game had going for it, it no longer does; a diverse playerbase. Fewer players means a more difficult time doing what this game advertises, small instanced dungeons that you can play with other people.Ignoring the heavy handed cash shop, theres other glaring issues that have shown up with the game over time. Mostly class relivance. Browsing the forums and from my experiance, there are several classes that just dont fall in line with their enteded effectiveness, and others that outshine. Back to the cash shop. Its very difficult and time consuming to make progress in the game unless you let the game nickle and dime you. The heavy handed promotion of their cash shop with the addition of gear upgrades and the high in game currancy cost promotes running many, many, many, end game/high level dungeons just for a small gain. Or you can toss a few bucks their way and speed up that process.Oh, and the actual gameplay is forgetable.

number of helpful: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 14, 2015
												First and most importantly, this game is not pay to win by any means. This game is pure, action combat with friends. I have played this game since it first came out, and when I heard it was on steam, I downloaded it here so I could keep track of how many hours I have sunk into this game. I caution anyone that downloads this game, prepare to invest an insane amount of time into it, because it will suck you in and never let go!Anyone who is tired of TAB Targeting MMO RPG's need look no further. Vindictus provides TRUE ACTION (not that TERA "true" action) But Legit, True - DODGE, BLOCK, I-Frames, Special moves, ACTION ORIENTED Combat. And the best thing that seperates this game from TERA, and those "would be" action MMO's? Vindictus does it with the most FLUID combat system on and online action RPG. Vindictus doesnt stop there, it just begins with the amazing combat, it continues with insanely good graphics. The beasts, bosses, and HUGE Raid monsters are so amazingly detailed it a damn wonder how this game is free. This could easily be a triple AAA $60 US Dollar game, hands down. I will end off with the most amazing thing about Vindictus aside from everything above. Vindictus rewards TRUE SKILL, and not your deep wallet. Any boss, any dungen, any 6-8 man raid can be soloed if you know what your doing. Throw in a few equally skilled friends, and you have yourself a 200 hours co-op campaign and thats only brushing the surface!I cant recommend this game enough, and I cant believe other games have not mirrored this TRUE COMBAT system, because it is a clear success.Stop Reading the Reviews. DOWNLOAD THIS GAME AND SAY GOODBYE TO YOUR SOCIAL LIFE!

												Vindictus is a great game with an great fighting style. The story is interesting and the characters are unique and have their own personalities. Each area is their own and have good bosses. The classes have their own fighting style and some have second weapons that give them a completely new move set and skills.            I LOVE this game. The best part: its FREE! I will recomend this game to fans of 3rd person hack and slash games.

												Vindictus is a unique take on the action RPG genre. While at times it can feel monotonous, the combat flows very well and is very rewarding. Working with friends is the only way to get past some areas without "grinding" levels though. I'd say 6/10

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 14, 2014
												Vindictus is one of those games you can just keep playing!  Even if you leave for years on end if you try it and wonder wether you should remove it the answer is always "Keep it" with a complementary 20 hours of time.  Nexon has done a good job of balancing the characters while adding new content plus an amazing story!  There is so much life in the story that you could play the game just pressing "chitchat" with npcs.  Exiting town there is a plethora of monsters from small wolfish humanoids (gnolls) to Giant Dragons who should in theory be able to eat you in one gulp!Vindictus is a great game and has something in for everyone who enjoys combos, good story, and multiplayer.

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 22, 2014
												I suck at writing reviews so I am gonna just do my best. Pros: 7 classes currently with new class incoming. Each class has many different approaches to combat. Incredible PvE environment with sometimes as many as 24 players working together to take down seriously huge bosses. HUGE array of weapons and Armors. For the most part friendly community (occasional exceptions). Cons: Regular Lag when playing online with many players. Cash shop prices are sometimes outrageous. $20 for a pet!?!? (Some pets are cheaper like $12. Guild System could use some polishing. PvP sometimes feels.... Dead.

												If you are interested in fast pace hack n slash mmo's this is the game for you. if you like high qualtiy graphics and insane boss fights this is the game for you. basically vindictus is a mmo hack n slash video game, yes there is skill to the game and takes practice with your character and the monsters to fight. the game has lag issues but you can look past it when u go to a low population channel on the server. it is a great game to play with friends, like if u download this tell your girlfriend and friends to download it too. i have to note this: this game requires you to use 85% of your mental power, meaning you have to read and pay attention to the NPC's or you will be lost. alot of people leave this game because. "they have no idea what to do, its too hard". when all you have to do is read. read! simple.

												This game is actually a really good MMO. I was surprised when my friend recommended it for me saying that it was f2p. With my experience with other f2p hack and slash based games I honestly wasn't going to be surprised if this game flopped. But the fact I've played it almost non-stop since I got it has got to say something for it. The pay if you want extra stuff is very interesting. Especially since a good bit of the items are temporary. This means that everyone, pay or not, has the same chances in all their skills from level 1 to 85. I recommend this game 100%!

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 24, 2014
												Combat is fun.  Combat is visceral tight and very well done.  The core of this game is the combat which it excells at delivering.  The game starts out strong and is very engaging and draws players in well.  As you progress you learn new skills and abilities which allow you to get even more creative.  You can either solo your way through dungeons or play together with strangers and friends.  The game is a blast up until endgame.  I quit the game after reaching end game.  Our guild simply grew bored with the game.  At end game you will do nothing but particticpate in daily raids and hope for a rare drop so you can build new gear which will help with raiding.  Farming gets annoying repetitive and dull.  The game is unnesscarily cruel with drop rates.  Any enchant scrolls worth using are all extremely rare and hard to come by.  One time a friend and me spent a whole day ( i am not kidding we spent at least 4-6 hours running the same 15 dungeon over and over and over and over again to get a single scroll)  He got the scroll and continued playing with me until I got one.  After this you have to attempt to apply the enchant to an item and if its a good scroll (ie the only ones worth having) the chance of failure is very very very high.  Not to metion the fact that acquiring the materials for applying the enchant are rare themselves. Also if you fail an enchant the item can potentially break.  Yes the item you created after spending countless days weeks and months even can break.  We both failed our enchants.  His extremely powerful and rare weapon which he crafted from rare materials acquired from many raids we fought together broke.  My weapon only went down in durability.  At end game all you do is farm farm farm farm.  You farm for rare mats to make high end gear.  Than farm for scrolls to enchant said gear only to fail enchant and break gear.  at which point you repeat the process.  Our guild as a whole simply grew tired of the repetitive nonsense and we all quit. Of course you can buy item with real money to prevent item breaking and increase enchant success rate.  This has made the end game very very very pay to win.  I have nothing against cash shops so long as everything bought within said cash shops is purly cosmetic.  The Vindictus cash shop has cosmetic and pay to win items.  Underneath all the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t is a beautiful fantastic game that i love and will always love.  The farming and the pay to win drove me and several other long time players away from this fantastic gem of a game.  The game needs a vast overhaul.  Mat drop rates need drastic increases.  Weapon breaking needs to be removed completly.  Pay to win needs to be removed.

content:
Posted: March 5, 2016
												A genuinely fun mmo with action/combo based gameplay. Honestly, the gameplay is fun as hell. Theres probably a story in there somewhere, but most of my time was spent doing really flashy♥♥♥♥♥♥with dual weapons. I had a blast playing it.There are a few downsides, of course. Some of these are personal tastes, like the looks of armor or the character system (I like being able to completely make my character, not pick an archtype with 3 hairstyles), whereas others are things like the fairly low amount of people playing, or how things can require insane amounts of grinding missions to make.Overall, there are a few flaws, but I highly recomend this game. It is fun, somewhat challenging, and a great free game.

content:
Posted: January 9, 2015
												If you enjoy playing the same levels over and over again with constantly reused areas (a la oblivion style) and pointlessly easy minion engagements to get to the only thing that makes this game fun (the bosses) then congratulations, your brain stem is missing!If you enjoy interesting combat based in action and throwing old stuff at guys to knock them down this game is for you. Seriously, it is so satisfying to chuck giant rocks in a bosses face point blank to knock them down.-boring character customization (looks and stats)-despite combat being so fun most fights are so easy you will be falling asleep. Only for the most brain dead of mmo players-typical mmorpg antics of rapidly increasingly rediculously looking equipment (a minus in my book)-theres a story? ignore the tutorial level you will see nothing like that for the rest of the game-pay2win bs. Can only play so many times a day with a free account. Keeps you sane i guess-bearly a mmorpg. You could easily redesign this game as a coop rpg like diablo or borderlands. MMO elements either not there or pointless (mostly)+combat+combat+combat+boss fights+boob physics6/10

												If you enjoy playing the same levels over and over again with constantly reused areas (a la oblivion style) and pointlessly easy minion engagements to get to the only thing that makes this game fun (the bosses) then congratulations, your brain stem is missing!If you enjoy interesting combat based in action and throwing old stuff at guys to knock them down this game is for you. Seriously, it is so satisfying to chuck giant rocks in a bosses face point blank to knock them down.-boring character customization (looks and stats)-despite combat being so fun most fights are so easy you will be falling asleep. Only for the most brain dead of mmo players-typical mmorpg antics of rapidly increasingly rediculously looking equipment (a minus in my book)-theres a story? ignore the tutorial level you will see nothing like that for the rest of the game-pay2win bs. Can only play so many times a day with a free account. Keeps you sane i guess-bearly a mmorpg. You could easily redesign this game as a coop rpg like diablo or borderlands. MMO elements either not there or pointless (mostly)+combat+combat+combat+boss fights+boob physics6/10

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 5, 2016
												A genuinely fun mmo with action/combo based gameplay. Honestly, the gameplay is fun as hell. Theres probably a story in there somewhere, but most of my time was spent doing really flashy♥♥♥♥♥♥with dual weapons. I had a blast playing it.There are a few downsides, of course. Some of these are personal tastes, like the looks of armor or the character system (I like being able to completely make my character, not pick an archtype with 3 hairstyles), whereas others are things like the fairly low amount of people playing, or how things can require insane amounts of grinding missions to make.Overall, there are a few flaws, but I highly recomend this game. It is fun, somewhat challenging, and a great free game.

												Picture an ARPG MMO with instanced combat. Picture that combat is vaguely like Monster Hunter or Dark/Demon's Souls. It really is probably the best combat I've ever seen in a F2P game.Now picture that the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t grind of fighting the same monsters over and over again in hopes of a super-rare drop becomes a mandatory part of progression through the game. And also that each time you want to try a different weapon class, you have to create a new character.I will say it's worth it to experience up through the first main boss, maybe the second. Just expect the grind to become intolerable shortly thereafter.

number of helpful: 5 of 13 people (38%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 26, 2014
												When I found out that Vindictus was by the same guys as Maplestory, I had to try it. Luckily, I was not disappointed. The only problem I have with this game is that it lags when in a party, even at the lowest graphics settings. However, it is only an inconvenience, not a problem. The cutscenes are greatly done, and the story is beautiful. There are plenty of side quests to do, so you don't have to do the main quest immediately. People have complained that you need to grind in order to survive in this, which may be true (I'm not sure), but I enjoy grinding, so it's not a problem for me. All-in-all, I give it 9/10.

												Can't believe I looked forward to this game. While the fighting itself was quite fun and unique, the UI was chunky and completely ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥. Playing with a friend was worse, and if the quest item was collected by a single individual it would not be able to be traded to the other person to complete a quest for both individuals (unless we mailed it, and then you'd need to be level 10, and then you'd also have to spend money to mail it to the other person). Waste of HD space, and I was frustrated long before level 5, and not a friendly game to play from beginning with another friend.

number of helpful: 3 of 9 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 21, 2016
												horrible. the devs were so lazy with the dungeons that you have to play them several times in a row to accomplish some pointless goals. 19 levels in, still stuck running the same boring ice dungeon fighting the exact same enemies with the exact same moves. around this point, the story xp s.h.i.t.s itself and causes the player to have to grind the same dungeon even more to unlock the next story quest (2 levels higher for some f,..u,..c,..k,..e,..d reason). controls are also horrid. the character will usually swing in the direction of the camera which is incredibly stupid, but sometimes they won't. i ended up trying to swing towards some bland kobolds for the millionth time and ended up snapping another direction, hitting a lever, and getting crushed by a spike trap. how in the f,..u,.,..c.,.k can we still not get controls right in this age? hitboxes are almost as bad as dark souls. i can be out of an enemy's swing and get hit. i can be too close for an enemy to hit with their oversized hammers and still get hit. i can be in the middle of a dodge, be under or above a swing, and get hit.on top of all that, there's not a bit of exploration. there's one town and you repeat the same handful of dungeons from the docks. there is an exploration board, but it's a lie. all that is is repeating raid bosses, but buffed tenfold. so, it's pointless and misnamed. garbage. pay to win, too. i got a bunch of free gear with timers that far outclassed everything normally available. speaking of timers, i checked the pay to win store. there's timers on paid items. yes. you pay for temporary items. OR you can spend double to make them permanent. this means, 20 dollars for a permanent outfit, or 10 for it to wear off in a month. how does that make any sense??nexon, by the way. that really explains it all. has nexon made anything not bad?

number of helpful: 1 of 5 people (20%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 8, 2014
												This is another example of how a bad company like nexon can ruin a great game, This game has been through so much i feel so bad, first it had no game securitym you could easily be hacked and there were botters everywhere, then nexon got mad cause people stopped buying nx and decided to go on a ban frenzy, banning people who did or didnt do anything,this game has the worst drop rates known to man, at one point, to get endgame armour was 1 in 800 with only 3 chances a day.Ill explain how it works, you level up to do raids so you can get rares, to sell, to buy armour, to do higher raids, to get rares to sell, to do higher raids, Sounds like a pretty stable system doesn't it, then nexon ruins it by making it hard as balls to level up, with the only reward being 2 or 3 more raids you can do, rares so godamn rare its ridiculous and armour that doesn't mean squat if you cant enhance it which in its own aspect is a death sentence.with all that i still play it, i still love it i still spend ridiculous ammounts of money on it, becuase it is the best mmo out there right now in terms of combat and visuals, All i can say is, play it with the realization that it will make you happy and then rip out your heart.
